body.p:
Sep 16. 1861
To his Excellency B Magoffin Gov of Kentucky

The undersigned respectfully adamently request your Excellency to release from his penalty, inflicted by a Jury of Woodford County upon a warrant for a breach of the peace committed in Said County and which is more particularly referred to & set out in the paper accompanying this petition, Frank Armstrong. It is true that he did commit a breach of the peace as charged, but he respectfully represent that his offense was committed under circumstances of great aggravation to him and we believe he is truly penetent therefor. If you will pardon him, we can assure you that the offense will not be repeated and that he will take himself out of the way.

Respectfully
W T Martin
Wm L Graddy
D P Robb Police Judge
Town of Versailles
S,, Stone T M V of
Mason R Henry
W. J. Carlyle
Saml S. Darneal
Lavenia Armstrong, wife of F Armstrong

Versailles Cir. Ct
Respite 3 Mo
B. M.

Fifteen days Imprisonment
Frank Armstrong
Issd Sept 16. 1861
